00031 #include "BLI_math.h"
00032 #include "BLI_rand.h"
00033 #include "BLI_string.h"
00034 #include "BLI_utildefines.h"

00045 #include "BKE_deform.h"

00051 #include "MEM_guardedalloc.h"

00056 /* Maps new_w weights in place, using either one of the predefined functions, or a custom curve.
00057  * Return values are in new_w.
00058  * If indices is not NULL, it must be a table of same length as org_w and new_w, mapping to the real
00059  * vertex index (in case the weight tables do not cover the whole vertices...).
00060  * cmap might be NULL, in which case curve mapping mode will return unmodified data.
00061  */
00062 void weightvg_do_map(int num, float *new_w, short falloff_type, CurveMapping *cmap)
00063 {
00064     int i;
00065 
00066     /* Return immediately, if we have nothing to do! */
00067     /* Also security checks... */
00068     if (((falloff_type == MOD_WVG_MAPPING_CURVE) && (cmap == NULL)) ||
00069         !ELEM7(falloff_type, MOD_WVG_MAPPING_CURVE, MOD_WVG_MAPPING_SHARP, MOD_WVG_MAPPING_SMOOTH,
00070                MOD_WVG_MAPPING_ROOT, MOD_WVG_MAPPING_SPHERE, MOD_WVG_MAPPING_RANDOM,
00071                MOD_WVG_MAPPING_STEP))
00072         return;
00073 
00074     /* Map each weight (vertex) to its new value, accordingly to the chosen mode. */
00075     for (i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
00076         float fac = new_w[i];
00077 
00078         /* Code borrowed from the warp modifier. */
00079         /* Closely matches PROP_SMOOTH and similar. */
00080         switch(falloff_type) {
00081         case MOD_WVG_MAPPING_CURVE:
00082             fac = curvemapping_evaluateF(cmap, 0, fac);
00083             break;
00084         case MOD_WVG_MAPPING_SHARP:
00085             fac = fac*fac;
00086             break;
00087         case MOD_WVG_MAPPING_SMOOTH:
00088             fac = 3.0f*fac*fac - 2.0f*fac*fac*fac;
00089             break;
00090         case MOD_WVG_MAPPING_ROOT:
00091             fac = (float)sqrt(fac);
00092             break;
00093         case MOD_WVG_MAPPING_SPHERE:
00094             fac = (float)sqrt(2*fac - fac * fac);
00095             break;
00096         case MOD_WVG_MAPPING_RANDOM:
00097             BLI_srand(BLI_rand()); /* random seed */
00098             fac = BLI_frand()*fac;
00099             break;
00100         case MOD_WVG_MAPPING_STEP:
00101             fac = (fac >= 0.5f)?1.0f:0.0f;
00102             break;
00103         }
00104 
00105         new_w[i] = fac;
00106     }
00107 }
00108 
00109 /* Applies new_w weights to org_w ones, using either a texture, vgroup or constant value as factor.
00110  * Return values are in org_w.
00111  * If indices is not NULL, it must be a table of same length as org_w and new_w, mapping to the real
00112  * vertex index (in case the weight tables do not cover the whole vertices...).
00113  * XXX The standard "factor" value is assumed in [0.0, 1.0] range. Else, weird results might appear.
00114  */
00115 void weightvg_do_mask(int num, const int *indices, float *org_w, const float *new_w,
00116                       Object *ob, DerivedMesh *dm, float fact, const char defgrp_name[MAX_VGROUP_NAME],
00117                       Scene *scene, Tex *texture, int tex_use_channel, int tex_mapping,
00118                       Object *tex_map_object, const char *tex_uvlayer_name)
00119 {
00120     int ref_didx;
00121     int i;
00122 
00123     /* If influence factor is null, nothing to do! */
00124     if (fact == 0.0f) return;
00125 
00126     /* If we want to mask vgroup weights from a texture. */
00127     if (texture) {
00128         /* The texture coordinates. */
00129         float (*tex_co)[3];
00130         /* See mapping note below... */
00131         MappingInfoModifierData t_map;
00132         float (*v_co)[3];
00133 
00134         /* Use new generic get_texture_coords, but do not modify our DNA struct for it...
00135          * XXX Why use a ModifierData stuff here ? Why not a simple, generic struct for parameters ?
00136          *     What e.g. if a modifier wants to use several textures ?
00137          *     Why use only v_co, and not MVert (or both) ?
00138          */
00139         t_map.texture = texture;
00140         t_map.map_object = tex_map_object;
00141         BLI_strncpy(t_map.uvlayer_name, tex_uvlayer_name, sizeof(t_map.uvlayer_name));
00142         t_map.texmapping = tex_mapping;
00143         v_co = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(*v_co) * num, "WeightVG Modifier, TEX mode, v_co");
00144         dm->getVertCos(dm, v_co);
00145         tex_co = MEM_callocN(sizeof(*tex_co) * num, "WeightVG Modifier, TEX mode, tex_co");
00146         get_texture_coords(&t_map, ob, dm, v_co, tex_co, num);
00147         MEM_freeN(v_co);
00148 
00149         modifier_init_texture(scene, texture);
00150 
00151         /* For each weight (vertex), make the mix between org and new weights. */
00152         for (i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
00153             int idx = indices ? indices[i] : i;
00154             TexResult texres;
00155             float h, s, v; /* For HSV color space. */
00156 
00157             texres.nor = NULL;
00158             get_texture_value(texture, tex_co[idx], &texres);
00159             /* Get the good channel value... */
00160             switch(tex_use_channel) {
00161             case MOD_WVG_MASK_TEX_USE_INT:
00162                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * texres.tin * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (texres.tin*fact)));
00163                 break;
00164             case MOD_WVG_MASK_TEX_USE_RED:
00165                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * texres.tr * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (texres.tr*fact)));
00166                 break;
00167             case MOD_WVG_MASK_TEX_USE_GREEN:
00168                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * texres.tg * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (texres.tg*fact)));
00169                 break;
00170             case MOD_WVG_MASK_TEX_USE_BLUE:
00171                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * texres.tb * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (texres.tb*fact)));
00172                 break;
00173             case MOD_WVG_MASK_TEX_USE_HUE:
00174                 rgb_to_hsv(texres.tr, texres.tg, texres.tb, &h, &s, &v);
00175                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * h * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (h*fact)));
00176                 break;
00177             case MOD_WVG_MASK_TEX_USE_SAT:
00178                 rgb_to_hsv(texres.tr, texres.tg, texres.tb, &h, &s, &v);
00179                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * s * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (s*fact)));
00180                 break;
00181             case MOD_WVG_MASK_TEX_USE_VAL:
00182                 rgb_to_hsv(texres.tr, texres.tg, texres.tb, &h, &s, &v);
00183                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * v * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (v*fact)));
00184                 break;
00185             case MOD_WVG_MASK_TEX_USE_ALPHA:
00186                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * texres.ta * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (texres.ta*fact)));
00187                 break;
00188             default:
00189                 org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * texres.tin * fact) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f - (texres.tin*fact)));
00190                 break;
00191             }
00192         }
00193 
00194         MEM_freeN(tex_co);
00195     }
00196     else if ((ref_didx = defgroup_name_index(ob, defgrp_name)) != -1) {
00197         MDeformVert *dvert = NULL;
00198 
00199         /* Check whether we want to set vgroup weights from a constant weight factor or a vertex
00200          * group.
00201          */
00202         /* Get vgroup idx from its name. */
00203 
00204         /* Proceed only if vgroup is valid, else use constant factor. */
00205         /* Get actual dverts (ie vertex group data). */
00206         dvert = dm->getVertDataArray(dm, CD_MDEFORMVERT);
00207         /* Proceed only if vgroup is valid, else assume factor = O. */
00208         if (dvert == NULL) return;
00209 
00210         /* For each weight (vertex), make the mix between org and new weights. */
00211         for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00212             int idx = indices ? indices[i] : i;
00213             const float f = defvert_find_weight(&dvert[idx], ref_didx) * fact;
00214             org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * f) + (org_w[i] * (1.0f-f));
00215             /* If that vertex is not in ref vgroup, assume null factor, and hence do nothing! */
00216         }
00217     }
00218     else {
00219         /* Default "influence" behavior. */
00220         /* For each weight (vertex), make the mix between org and new weights. */
00221         const float ifact = 1.0f - fact;
00222         for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00223             org_w[i] = (new_w[i] * fact) + (org_w[i] * ifact);
00224         }
00225     }
00226 }
00227 
00228 
00229 
00230 
00231 /* Applies weights to given vgroup (defgroup), and optionally add/remove vertices from the group.
00232  * If dws is not NULL, it must be an array of MDeformWeight pointers of same length as weights (and
00233  * defgrp_idx can then have any value).
00234  * If indices is not NULL, it must be an array of same length as weights, mapping to the real
00235  * vertex index (in case the weight array does not cover the whole vertices...).
00236  */
00237 void weightvg_update_vg(MDeformVert *dvert, int defgrp_idx, MDeformWeight **dws, int num,
00238                         const int *indices, const float *weights, int do_add,
00239                         float add_thresh, int do_rem, float rem_thresh)
00240 {
00241     int i;
00242 
00243     for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00244         float w = weights[i];
00245         MDeformVert *dv = &dvert[indices ? indices[i] : i];
00246         MDeformWeight *dw = dws ? dws[i] : defvert_find_index(dv, defgrp_idx);
00247 
00248         /* Never allow weights out of [0.0, 1.0] range. */
00249         CLAMP(w, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00250 
00251         /* If the vertex is in this vgroup, remove it if needed, or just update it. */
00252         if (dw != NULL) {
00253             if (do_rem && w < rem_thresh) {
00254                 defvert_remove_group(dv, dw);
00255             }
00256             else {
00257                 dw->weight = w;
00258             }
00259         }
00260         /* Else, add it if needed! */
00261         else if (do_add && w > add_thresh) {
00262             defvert_add_index_notest(dv, defgrp_idx, w);
00263         }
00264     }
00265 }
